meanings.definition: The act of constructing or erecting buildings.
meanings.sent1: The biggings of the new school took many months to complete.
meanings.sent2: The biggings in the city skyline are a testament to human creativity.
meanings.sent3: The biggings of the gingerbread house collapsed before the gingerbread man could move in.
meanings.sent4: The biggings of the sandcastle stood tall until the tide washed them away.
meanings.sent5: The biggings of the treehouse were so sturdy, they could withstand strong winds.

meanings.definition: A large or impressive building or structure.
meanings.sent1: The medieval castle was one of the grandest biggings in the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The biggings of the palace gleamed in the sunlight, showcasing its opulence.
meanings.sent3: The biggings of the amusement park roller coaster made it look like a thrilling adventure.
meanings.sent4: The biggings of the mountain loomed large against the horizon, inviting climbers to conquer its peak.
meanings.sent5: The biggings of the cathedral soared high into the sky, inspiring awe in all who beheld it.
